contentrichtext.text: The [[Swazi people|Swazi]] are an [[ethnic group]] split between [[South Africa]] and [[Swaziland]]. The Swazis in South Africa became a major part of [[Music of South Africa|South African music]], though they were not identified as ''Swazi musicians'', but rather as ''South African musicians''; these included [[Zakes Nkosi]], who began in the 1940s as a [[jazz]] musician ==Traditional instruments== *[[makeyana]]: a single-stringed, gourd-resonated [[musical bow]] <ref>{{cite web|title=Traditional Swazi Music, South Africa - Sound Clip - ninemsn Encarta <!-- BOT GENERATED TITLE -->|url=http://au.encarta.msn.com/media_121622286_761557321_-1_1/Traditional_Swazi_Music_South_Africa.html|work=|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5kwbwLOJ8|archivedate=2009-10-31|deadurl=yes}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} *{{cite web|title=Traditional Swazi Music, South Africa - Sound Clip - ninemsn Encarta <!-- BOT GENERATED TITLE -->|url=http://au.encarta.msn.com/media_121622286_761557321_-1_1/Traditional_Swazi_Music_South_Africa.html|work=|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5kwbwLOJ8|archivedate=2009-10-31|deadurl=yes}} ==External links== *[http://au.encarta.msn.com/media_121622286_761557321_-1_1/Traditional_Swazi_Music_South_Africa.html Download sample] ([http://www.webcitation.org/5kwbwLOJ8 Archived] 2009-10-31) [[Category:Swazi music]] [[Category:South African styles of music]]
